content:
DIY party favors are a great way to add a personal touch to your niece's party without breaking the bank. Here are some budget-friendly DIY party favor ideas that can be made in advance:

**1. Sparkly Sugar Cookies**:
Cost: $5-10 (depending on ingredients)
Bake and decorate sugar cookies with sparkly sprinkles or edible glitter. Package them in cute bags or containers with a personalized label.

**2. Glittery Playdough**:
Cost: $5-10 (depending on ingredients)
Make homemade playdough and add glitter to give it a sparkly touch. Package in small containers or bags with a cute label.

**3. DIY Bath Bombs**:
Cost: $10-15 (depending on ingredients)
Mix baking soda, citric acid, and essential oils to create fizzy bath bombs. Add a few drops of food coloring and glitter for a fun touch. Package in small bags or containers.

**4. Sparkly Stickers or Tattoos**:
Cost: $5-10 (depending on quantity)
Design and print your own stickers or temporary tattoos with sparkly designs. You can also add a personalized message or your niece's name.

**5. Glittery Pencils or Crayons**:
Cost: $5-10 (depending on quantity)
Decorate plain pencils or crayons with glitter glue, stickers, or washi tape. Add a personalized label or tag with your niece's name.

**6. Mini Sparkly Notebooks**:
Cost: $10-15 (depending on quantity)
Decorate small notebooks with glitter glue, stickers, or washi tape. Add a personalized message or your niece's name on the cover.

**7. DIY Glitter Slime**:
Cost: $10-15 (depending on ingredients)
Make homemade slime and add glitter for a fun touch. Package in small containers or bags with a cute label.

**8. Sparkly Bookmarks**:
Cost: $5-10 (depending on quantity)
Design and print your own bookmarks with sparkly designs. Add a personalized message or your niece's name.

**9. Glittery Hair Clips**:
Cost: $10-15 (depending on quantity)
Decorate plain hair clips with glitter glue, stickers, or washi tape. Add a personalized label or tag with your niece's name.

**10. DIY Sparkly Candy**:
Cost: $10-15 (depending on ingredients)
Make your own candy, such as rock candy or candy melts, and add glitter for a fun touch. Package in small bags or containers with a cute label.

Remember, the key to making DIY party favors is to keep it simple, be creative, and have fun! With a little bit of effort, you can create unique and personalized party favors that your niece and her friends will love.
